mil5.2.7:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil5.2.7:0.4_0: The group of four factors on simultaneous probation with being sent back to the beginning.
mil5.2.7:1.1_0: “When the Buddha spoke like this, he said,
mil5.2.7:1.2_0: that I’m not, Ānanda, I’ll lead the Sangha of monks.
mil5.2.7:1.3_0: Furthermore, I used to sit with bad qualities to say:
mil5.2.7:1.4_0: ‘I will serve the mendicant Saṅgha with the other thousands of mendicants now as I do today.’
mil5.2.7:1.5_0: And he told him about this.
mil5.2.7:1.6_0: ‘I won’t do, Ānanda. I’ll take charge of the Saṅgha of mendicants.”
mil5.2.7:1.7_0: When the Realized One had spoken,
mil5.2.7:1.8_0: that the Saṅgha of mendicants is bierceiving with a hundred thousand monks. They are just like that. They’re devoted to the mendicant Saṅgha, and I don’t consent to rub them, “That’s a monk in charge of building work.”
mil5.2.7:2.1_0: “Great king, the Buddha has said that the Realized One is well spoken, but I don’t think of them worth listening to.”
mil5.2.7:2.2_0: And the Buddha spoke of affairs to me once again and again with his request.
mil5.2.7:2.3_0: ‘I will serve the mendicant Saṅgha with the other thousands of mendicants now as I do today.’
mil5.2.7:2.4_0: That, great king, has the goal and is the reside of the rest.
mil5.2.7:2.5_0: He’s not an assembly of the Realized One.
mil5.2.7:2.6_0: They have been given, great king, that they are free of stains, but they don’t have a distorted perspective.
mil5.2.7:3.1_0: When the earth is grounded on the earth, the grounded on the earth, and the earth doesn’t think ‘the sentient beings are neither skilled nor trained in the earth.
mil5.2.7:3.2_0: In the same way, when a Realized One has grounded on all sides, he doesn’t think: ‘I’m not definitely.’
mil5.2.7:3.3_0: Whether they strike a large grass mat, great king,
mil5.2.7:3.4_0: If they live with the thought, but not all sentient beings are.
mil5.2.7:3.5_0: In the same way, when a Realized One generates enthusiasm, tries, makes an effort, exerts himself, and strives so that they haven’t explained the Realized One’s caravan.
mil5.2.7:3.7_0: view of self they’ve given up what has been given up.”
mil5.2.7:4.1_0: “It’s good, sir. For it’s good that you can see a lot of different colors. For seven strands!” And that tangled, made a dreadful racket.”
mil5.2.7:5.1_0: Questioning with a sangha of monks.
